result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:02 PM Defendant Michael Thomas Pozsgay in court.  Attorney Jane Krueger Smith in court for Michael Thomas Pozsgay.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. Waiver of preliminary hearing filed with the Court. The defendant freely and voluntarily waives the right to the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts the waiver. Court finds probable cause.  Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed.  Court advises defendant of charges & penalties. Defendant waives reading of information. Defendant stands mute, Court enters not guilty plea on defendants behalf. Bond Continues. Matter set over.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
